Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Phylloseptin-O2 (PLS-O2,  Phylloseptin-O5, Phylloseptin-5, PS-5, XXA, natural AMPs; UCLL1c; frog, amphibians, animals)
Sequence Information.Source: Brazilian tree frog,Phyllomedusa oreades, South America

Literature Information.Literature: C-terminal NH2. It has trypanocidal activity (T. cruzi) as well (0.5 ug/ml, 33% lysis; 30 ug/ml 100% lysis). Chagas disease is caused by the parasite. UPdated 3/2020; validated 7/2021
Literature Information.Author: Leite JR, Silva LP, Rodrigues MI, Prates MV, Brand GD, Lacava BM, Azevedo RB, Bocca AL, Albuquerque S, Bloch C Jr.2005
Literature Information.Title: Phylloseptins: a novel class of anti-bacterial and anti-protozoan peptides from the Phyllomedusa genus.
